findings.title: Hardcoded External Repository Clone Without Verification
findings.description: The installation instructions direct users to clone a GitHub repository (https://github.com/BENZEMA216/tradingcoach.git) without any integrity verification, version pinning, or provenance checking. This creates a supply chain risk where malicious code could be introduced through repository compromise or typosquatting.
findings.remediation: Add commit hash verification, use signed releases, or include integrity checksums. Document the expected repository state and warn users to verify the source.

metadata.overall_assessment: This trading analysis skill presents MEDIUM security risks primarily related to supply chain security and sensitive data handling. The skill requires users to clone an external GitHub repository and install unpinned dependencies without verification mechanisms, creating supply chain vulnerabilities. Additionally, it processes highly sensitive financial trading data (broker CSV exports containing transaction history and P&L information) without providing security guidance on data privacy and handling. The skill itself does not contain malicious code in the provided materials - no scripts were included for analysis, only documentation. However, the installation process and data handling practices need security improvements. The missing optional metadata fields (license, compatibility, allowed-tools) reduce transparency but are low severity issues. Overall, this appears to be a legitimate trading analysis tool with supply chain and data privacy concerns that should be addressed.
primary_threats: Supply Chain Risk (unpinned dependencies, unverified repository clone)
Sensitive Data Exposure (financial trading data without security guidance)
Missing Security Metadata (license, compatibility, allowed-tools not specified)
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The skill explicitly instructs users to clone and execute code from an external repository without any verification mechanism. This is a documented supply chain risk pattern.
metadata.meta_exploitability: Medium - Requires attacker to compromise the GitHub repository or register a typosquatted domain, but once compromised, all users following the instructions would be affected.
metadata.meta_impact: High - Malicious code in the repository could access sensitive trading data, exfiltrate credentials, or compromise the user's system.

findings.title: Unpinned Dependency Installation
findings.description: The skill instructs users to run 'pip install -r requirements.txt' without specifying or documenting pinned versions. This creates supply chain vulnerability where malicious or compromised package versions could be installed.
findings.remediation: Pin all dependencies to specific versions in requirements.txt. Use hash verification (pip install --require-hashes). Document expected package versions.

metadata.meta_confidence_reason: Unpinned dependencies are a well-documented supply chain vulnerability. The skill references requirements.txt but doesn't provide it or specify versions.
metadata.meta_exploitability: Medium - Requires attacker to publish malicious package versions or compromise existing packages, but affects all users who install after the compromise.
metadata.meta_impact: High - Malicious dependencies could access trading data, steal credentials, or execute arbitrary code.

findings.title: Sensitive Financial Data Processing Without Security Guidance
findings.description: The skill processes sensitive financial trading data (CSV files containing transaction history, account positions, P&L data) but provides no security guidance on data handling, storage, or privacy. Users may inadvertently expose sensitive financial information.
findings.snippet: 将券商导出的CSV交易记录,转化为专业级复盘报告 - processes broker CSV exports containing sensitive trading data
findings.remediation: Add explicit security warnings about: (1) Not sharing CSV files containing real trading data, (2) Data retention policies, (3) Secure deletion after analysis, (4) Privacy considerations when using AI analysis features.

Sensitive Data Exposure (financial trading data without security guidance)
Missing Security Metadata (license, compatibility, allowed-tools not specified)
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The skill explicitly processes sensitive financial data from multiple brokers but provides zero security guidance. This is a clear gap in responsible data handling.
metadata.meta_exploitability: Low - Requires user error (e.g., storing unencrypted data in cloud sync folders), but the lack of guidance increases risk.
metadata.meta_impact: Medium - Exposure of trading history could reveal financial status, trading strategies, or enable identity theft.
